timeline.body:
Once the request is an enum, then you can do a switch statement on it like this:
```suggestion
        switch(request){
             case OPEN:
```
This would eliminate the need for `getValue` on your enum.

Another approach that would utilize the `getValue` instead of using a switch statement would be to construct the `queryParams` directly.
```
String queryParams = "&"+request.getValue()+"=1";
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Once the request is an enum, then you can do a switch statement on it like this:

Suggested change
if (request.equals(OpenGarageCommand.OPEN.getValue())) {
switch(request){
case OPEN:

This would eliminate the need for getValue on your enum.

Another approach that would utilize the getValue instead of using a switch statement would be to construct the queryParams directly.

String queryParams = "&"+request.getValue()+"=1";

timeline.bodyHTML:
You forgot to add break statements.

Suggested change
queryParams = "&open=1";
case CLOSE:
queryParams = "&close=1";
case CLICK:
queryParams = "&click=1";
queryParams = "&open=1";
break;
case CLOSE:
queryParams = "&close=1";
break;
case CLICK:
queryParams = "&click=1";
break;

timeline.author: digitaldan

timeline.body: This is a small nit, but do you need a switch statement at all? It only has one outcome.  i would think you could simply remove the switch statement and just jump straight to checking the command types.
timeline.bodyText: This is a small nit, but do you need a switch statement at all? It only has one outcome.  i would think you could simply remove the switch statement and just jump straight to checking the command types.

timeline.author: digitaldan

replies.bodyText: I guess we could do this, I think this is safer as we at least make sure the right channel is receiving the command?
replies.author: psmedley

timeline.bodyHTML:
small nit pick, would maybe a switch statement be cleaner here?

switch(controllerVariables.door){
    case 0:
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS, OnOffType.OFF);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_SWITCH, OnOffType.OFF);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_ROLLERSHUTTER, UpDownType.DOWN);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_CONTACT, OpenClosedType.CLOSED);
        break;
    case 1:
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS, OnOffType.ON);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_SWITCH, OnOffType.ON);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_ROLLERSHUTTER, UpDownType.UP);
        updateState(OpenGarageBindingConstants.CHANNEL_OG_STATUS_CONTACT, OpenClosedType.OPEN);
        break;
    default:
        logger.warn("Received unknown door value: {}", controllerVariables.door);
}

And of course the same for the vehicle state below.
timeline.author: digitaldan

replies.bodyText: I was just looking at this and thinking the same thing :)
